intro: Lilium byzantinum, commonly known as the Byzantine lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces large, showy flowers with six to nine petals, typically in shades of pink to red. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Lilium byzantinum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
